queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-clean-lingering-siembol-jobs}}.spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-clean-lingering-siembol-jobs}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-clean-lingering-siembol-jobs}}.spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-clean-lingering-siembol-jobs}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

files.expected_value: 'spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.serviceAccountName' should not be shared with other workloads

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Cronjobs must have a configured deadline, which means the attribute 'startingDeadlineSeconds' must be defined
Image tag must be defined and not be empty or equal to latest.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.image tag is provided and not latest
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-rest}}.image tag is not provided or latest

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-config-editor-ui}}.image tag is provided and not latest

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.image tag is provided and not latest
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.image tag is not provided or latest

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{release-name-siembol-storm-topology-manager}}

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context

queries.query_name: Object Is Using A Deprecated API Version
queries.description: Kubernetes APIs evolve over time and are sometimes removed with newer releases. To prevent incompatibilities when upgrading Kubernetes, deprecated APIs should be replaced with newer and more stable API versions.

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-siembol-clean-lingering-siembol-jobs}}.apiVersion of CronJob  is deprecated and is {{batch/v1beta1}}
